library('rjson') library('tidyverse') library('janitor') library('lubridate') library('ggplot2') library('scales') library('ggpmisc') dados\_json\_mortos <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/deaths") dados\_json\_casos <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/confirmed") # dados\_json\_curados <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/recovered") json2tibble <- function(data) { mapply(as.data.frame, data, SIMPLIFY = FALSE) %>% do.call(rbind, .) %>% clean\_names %>% as\_tibble %>% mutate(data = ymd(substr(date, 0, 10))) %>% group\_by(data) %>% summarise(cases = max(cases)) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(novos = c('+0', paste0('+', diff(cases))), novos = ifelse(novos == '+0', '', novos)) %>% subset(cases > 0) } dados\_mortos <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_mortos) %>% mutate(stat = 'Mortes') dados\_casos <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_casos) %>% mutate(stat = 'Confirmados') # dados\_curados <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_curados) %>% mutate(stat = 'Curados') dados <- do.call(rbind, list(dados\_mortos, dados\_casos)) dados %>% ggplot(aes(x = data, y = cases, label = novos, group = stat)) + geom\_step(aes(color = stat)) + geom\_text(vjust = -.25, hjust = 1) + scale\_color\_hue('') + theme\_bw() + theme(legend.position = 'top') + scale\_x\_date(labels = label\_date\_short(), breaks = breaks\_width("2 days")) + scale\_y\_continuous(labels = label\_number(big.mark = '.', decimal.mark = ',')) + ylab('Casos') + xlab('Data') + labs(title = 'Casos de COVID-19 no Brasil', caption = 'Fonte: https://covid19api.com/', subtitle = sprintf('Data de elaboração: %s', format(Sys.Date(), format = '%d/%m/%Y'))) + annotate(geom = "table", label = list(dados %>% arrange(data) %>% group\_by(stat) %>% do(tail(., 1)) %>% mutate(casos = format(cases, big.mark = '.', decimal.mark = ',')) %>% select(Casos = stat, Quantidade = casos)), x = min(dados$data), y = max(dados$cases), vjust = 1, hjust = 0)

[http://siddharathadhumale.blogspot.com/2019/07/how-to-upload-new-created-projet-in.html](http://siddharathadhumale.blogspot.com/2019/07/how-to-upload-new-created-projet-in.html)

1- Create gitbub account 2- Create new repository on that github account 3- From Eclipse first go to GIT prospective 4- Try to clone the empty \*.git repository in step-2 5- Then import above step 4 repositories in our Eclipse Workspace project 6- Copy all the code which we want to upload to the git in that newly imported project in eclipse work space 7- Refresh the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. We will be able to see all the code in it. 8- Run the following command from project space right click project--> Team --> Synchronized work space 9- Refresh the the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. 10- Open GIT Staging from Eclipse Quick Access 11- Enter the comments and push the code to GIT.

1- Create gitbub account 2- Create new repository on that github account 3- From Eclipse first go to GIT prospective 4- Try to clone the empty \*.git repository in step-2 5- Then import above step 4 repositories in our Eclipse Workspace project 6- Copy all the code which we want to upload to the git in that newly imported project in eclipse work space 7- Refresh the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. We will be able to see all the code in it. 8- Run the following command from project space right click project--> Team --> Synchronized work space 9- Refresh the the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. 10- Open GIT Staging from Eclipse Quick Access 11- Enter the comments and push the code to GIT.

1- Create gitbub account 2- Create new repository on that github account 3- From Eclipse first go to GIT prospective 4- Try to clone the empty \*.git repository in step-2 5- Then import above step 4 repositories in our Eclipse Workspace project 6- Copy all the code which we want to upload to the git in that newly imported project in eclipse work space 7- Refresh the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. We will be able to see all the code in it. 8- Run the following command from project space right click project--> Team --> Synchronized work space 9- Refresh the the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. 10- Open GIT Staging from Eclipse Quick Access 11- Enter the comments and push the code to GIT.

1- Create gitbub account 2- Create new repository on that github account 3- From Eclipse first go to GIT prospective 4- Try to clone the empty \*.git repository in step-2 5- Then import above step 4 repositories in our Eclipse Workspace project 6- Copy all the code which we want to upload to the git in that newly imported project in eclipse work space 7- Refresh the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. We will be able to see all the code in it. 8- Run the following command from project space right click project--> Team --> Synchronized work space 9- Refresh the the project/clone project ui in GIT prospective in eclipse. 10- Open GIT Staging from Eclipse Quick Access 11- Enter the comments and push the code to GIT.

library('rjson') library('tidyverse') library('janitor') library('lubridate') library('ggplot2') library('scales') library('ggpmisc') dados\_json\_mortos <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/deaths") dados\_json\_casos <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/confirmed") # dados\_json\_curados <- fromJSON(file = "https://api.covid19api.com/country/brazil/status/recovered") json2tibble <- function(data) { mapply(as.data.frame, data, SIMPLIFY = FALSE) %>% do.call(rbind, .) %>% clean\_names %>% as\_tibble %>% mutate(data = ymd(substr(date, 0, 10))) %>% group\_by(data) %>% summarise(cases = max(cases)) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(novos = c('+0', paste0('+', diff(cases))), novos = ifelse(novos == '+0', '', novos)) %>% subset(cases > 0) } dados\_mortos <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_mortos) %>% mutate(stat = 'Mortes') dados\_casos <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_casos) %>% mutate(stat = 'Confirmados') # dados\_curados <- json2tibble(dados\_json\_curados) %>% mutate(stat = 'Curados') dados <- do.call(rbind, list(dados\_mortos, dados\_casos)) dados %>% ggplot(aes(x = data, y = cases, label = novos, group = stat)) + geom\_step(aes(color = stat)) + geom\_text(vjust = -.25, hjust = 1) + scale\_color\_hue('') + theme\_bw() + theme(legend.position = 'top') + scale\_x\_date(labels = label\_date\_short(), breaks = breaks\_width("2 days")) + scale\_y\_continuous(labels = label\_number(big.mark = '.', decimal.mark = ',')) + ylab('Casos') + xlab('Data') + labs(title = 'Casos de COVID-19 no Brasil', caption = 'Fonte: https://covid19api.com/', subtitle = sprintf('Data de elaboração: %s', format(Sys.Date(), format = '%d/%m/%Y'))) + annotate(geom = "table", label = list(dados %>% arrange(data) %>% group\_by(stat) %>% do(tail(., 1)) %>% mutate(casos = format(cases, big.mark = '.', decimal.mark = ',')) %>% select(Casos = stat, Quantidade = casos)), x = min(dados$data), y = max(dados$cases), vjust = 1, hjust = 0)
